Reviews.Title: “Long way out”
Reviews.Author: PetePhillips
Reviews.Content: I was rather misled by the title of this hotel which claims to be near Tower Bridge. It isn't. It is on Old Kent Road - in a run down area of London with nearest Tube (Elephant and Castle) a long way away. I made use of the buses a lot which are good but nowhere near as good as the tube. Staff were fine but tended towards silence and non-engagement. The £10 English breakfast was appalling - a sea of cheap beans with a rather of bacon, two overdone eggs and a piece of fatty hash brown - admittedly nice toast. Poor service in the real fast room and not a patch on other hotels I have visited in London. I went for the price just to see - I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Rebekka W
Reviews.Content: I paid £209 for 3 nights and was lucky enough to be upgraded on my stay. The location of the hotel is accessible to 24hr buses that take you on a 4-5min bus ride to the closest tube station (elephant & castle) which I found was very helpful. Although the area is not the greatest, I never felt in danger even when walking home at 11pm (although did get the odd stranger wanting a cigarette!). If your wanting to stay in central London I wouldn't recommend it, though I found that it didn't take me too long to get to the other side of town when needed. Just make sure when booking with this hotel you Google the location as it is not near Tower Bridge so if you check before hand it will save you disappointment in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good hotel in a rather down market area!”
Reviews.Author: YeovilSS
Reviews.Content: Easily missed (driven past it many times without seeing it) but for us wanting an hotel is this area it was ideal. We stayed 3 nights and found the room - although small - tidy, clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel has a car park £15 per night which you must book in advance as it's not over large. We felt it was more a business destination as there are no attractions nearby and there we no families as guests that we saw. We could not find any eateries that appealed to us so we got fish and chips one night to eat in the room and ate further afield other nights. The Old Kent Road isn't really the place for an evening's stroll being a bit down market. We didn't have breakfast do can't comment. But is was good value and it suited us fine.

Reviews.Title: “Only if needs be....”
Reviews.Author: EmilyAnna1990
Reviews.Content: Late review (sorry!) - I stayed here back in November for my friends 21st as a group of us were going to Ministry of Sound for a night out.The area is run down and the hotel in a good proximity to the club, however was quite far from the tube station so it was easier to take buses back in to central London rather than drag our suitcases and walk for 20 odd minutes. We didn't spend much time in the area nor the hotel but the rooms were clean and comfortable with tea and coffee making facilities, large TV, a great hot power shower and large bathroom. Although it is situated on a busy road and our room was facing this, the windows kept all the noise out so we all got a good few hours sleep! Although the area seemed very run down I felt very safe in the hotel even though we were coming back in the early hours. Would recommend if you need to be in the area for a night but don't expect too much for the price you pay for it....!

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: 186259Donna
Reviews.Content: I have to travel to London regularly and had previously stayed at the Aldgate East Travel Lodge (which was awful)...this Hotel however was a great find! My room was huge for a single traveller (I had booked on Late Rooms), the bathroom had a bath and a shower and my room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. The staff were very friendly and inviting and the hotel was pretty quiet which is rare for such a large one. A bonus was the secure car park attached to the hotel (a £10 charge but well worth it as you can walk from the car park straight in to the hotel). The dining room for breakfast however, was very small and felt very claustrophobic and dingy but I managed to get a table on the 3 occasions I stayed. I'm not sure the breakfast is worth the £10 they are charging but on balance the hotel was consistently good in every other respect.

Reviews.Title: “Mugging Central”
Reviews.Author: comedypilot
Reviews.Content: AVOID - firstly I am a local and run a theatre a few miles away and was shocked when discovered they call themselves Tower Bridge - it is nowhere near Tower Bridge, it is on the Old Kent Road. 2 miles away in one of the most crime ridden areas of London. My experience was that I was booking a hotel for some of my actors, our usual hotel in Greenwich was full, so search internet and this one came up. Thought £99 for a douible in TOWER BRIDGE was great value and and called to book the room for that evening. The reservation clark said I had to confirm the booking with a email, which I did as paying with our company card. I tried t give him the card details but he said, I has to come in person and pay as they will not confirm with cards (I wanted to make the full payment at the time). Tried to tell them that I was a business and the customers will not actually be me so cannnot just travel to them to make a payment in person. They said they must do it this way. So I ended up giving the clients the money in cash and told them to pay for the hotel when they arrived. Once at the hotel, they called to say that the hotel is no where near Tower Bridge and not near any tube or train and had to get there from the actual bridge by taxi. It was then I looked up the actual venue address and knew what a bad area it was in. Worst, they had accepted the cash but the hotel still insisited on a credit card which they did not have so made me drive to them to give them mine. Which I had to do, to. Stupid rules and no parking outside.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all for a stopover if you need to be near there - but not near tower bridge”
Reviews.Author: J&JWOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: Giving it four stars for what it is - cheap accommodation by London standards, don't go expecting a four star hotel. It isn't a place I would recommend as a base for a holiday either as it's not the best area for seeing London from. I stopped over here for one night when working South of the River. The area is not great, Old Kent Road is pretty run down. Parking was reasonably secure, clean and comfortable-ish rooms, reception OK, polite enough staff but not brimming with enthusiasm. The shower was OK but I agree with what others have said about it not draining quickly enough. Quite a bit of noise from the street, sirens were the main thing (I was on the top floor) but acceptable bearing in mind it's location (it was a Tuesday, not a weekend). Rooms at the back are much quieter, my colleague stayed in one and had a quiet night, so see if you can request one. The Chinese attached to the hotel Shu Castle, was pukka - really great food not your normal Cantonese fayre - proper Szechuan food, a real adventure. We were going to trek off for a curry but in the end went to the chinese and it was a great decision. We then wandered out to look for a nice little pub and decided after 3 or 4 mins walk that a 'nice pub' on Old Kent Road was probably wishful thinking and walked back (maybe we went the wrong way?)- the hotel has a little bar in reception anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly helpful staff and easy access to all London attractions”
Reviews.Author: KerryChannelIslands
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here for three nights, another friend decided she wanted to join for two nights so we called up on our day of arrival to see if this was possible. The staff were very helpful and at such short notice arranged an extra bed and only asked for an extra £10 a night. When we arrived the room was very clean and there was plenty of space for our three suitcases as well as plenty of room to walk around the room. The bathroom had a bath with shower over the top and a separate tap with drinking water and was very clean. Although the hotel was not exactly walking distance to any of the tourist attractions the hotel was located on a very good bus route, taking you either right past lots of the main attractions or to elephant and castle station and from there you can get anywhere you like. We purchased a day travel card each day, which providing you bought after 9.30am and travelled in zones 1 and 2 (which all attractions are within) it only cost £6.60 which you could use the bus, tubes and over ground trains. All in all I believe the location, cleanliness and friendliness of the staff at this hotel made our trip very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but poor location and very noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: Natilou
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Saturday night. The hotel was clean and our rooms were spacious. The location is not ideal but a cab cost approx £17 from the hotel to covent garden. Be warned there was karaoke playing next door until around 3 in the morning meaning we got very little sleep. We complained at 2 am but were not given another room and it appears this is a regular occurrence rather than a one off. Would not recommend this hotel because of the noise. Shame because the actual hotel was better than others I have stayed in for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel - But as mentioned - not an ideal location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: KellyB317
Reviews.Content: For the price that we paid (approx 70+pounds/ night) it was a decent hotel. It was clean and our room was quiet. If you're used to fluffy towels - I would definitely recommend bringing your own as the ones they give you are very thin and feel a bit like paper towels. It was a decent place to come back to sleep and I do believe the owners have made every effort to make it a nice stay. The area is a bit "sketchy" at night - I was with my boyfriend so I felt quite safe but would not have felt comfortable walking around the area at night. Unfortunately it really is quite far from Elephant and Castle - and with large pieces of luggage I would definitely recommend taking a cab. We tried to walk it - and it took us almost a good hour. It is within walking distance from Tower Bridge - about 20 minutes - but it is not really a nice typical London scenic walk with nice architecture or nice shops. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for cheap/ basic accommodation - that is not a hostel. If you don't mind jumping into a cab or talking a long walk to get into the city - this is a great place. If youre hoping to be closer to the center of the city - I would suggest one of the premier other locations. I noticed they did have some that were closer to Tower Bridge and in a closer location. The breakfast is an additional 10pounds per person. It honestly did not look like anything more than cereal and some juice and maybe some fruit. I didnt look very closely as we did not opt for the additional breakfast but there are lots of cheap little places around this hotel with great pasteries, convenience stores that you can get some breakfast at for much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised for London”
Reviews.Author: Papoofnik
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel room considering Old Kent Road location. It's biggest disadvantage is it is slightly outside the tourist zone if you want to easily walk to places and minimize tube and taxi. But this is London, you have to expect to take transport most places you go unless your like me, a walker. It was coming off the royal wedding when all hotels rooms were overpriced, and so paid as much as for a 4 star a week later. Having said that, it was priced better than the rest. Rooms were very clean and functional, and while not splashy, were modern in design, and slightly larger than comparable London hotels in this price range. Wifi is available at a fee. Front desk staff were very helpful, and their simple bus guide to access to the city was useful . Breakfast for the price was adequate and comparable to other places - not fine dining, but gets you going for the day. Be warned though, closest tube, is Elephant and Castle. With luggage, it is one to be missed, and trying to get a taxi outside is awkward. I found it better to get off at Waterloo and take a 10-12 GBP taxi ride to hotel, especially at night, or with bags. While the hotel would not be my first choice in London, if priced right, I would stay here again as it was not a bad experience as I have had with other places.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: stepyjk
Reviews.Content: Although was quite out of the way of where we needed to be - this hotel was very nice. It was clean and cheap - which is all we needed - after all we was only sleeping and getting changed there. Once we got used to what transport we needed to use it was fine - it is best to use bus as the stop is virually outside and the underground is quite a walk away. The road itself is not the best ion the world- but we wasnt paying to stay in a super glam hotel - so this suited us. Staff were helpful - we asked about the best way to get to and from the hotel and the man on reception gave us all the best bus routes to use to get to the main attractions which was very helpful. Rooms were very nice and comfy. Our room was near to the lift so had a bit of noise in the mornign when people where coming in/out - but that was no fault of the hotel, we just had noisy neighbours!! There is a chinese restaurant next door/connected which looked very nice - unfortunatly we didnt get chance to sample it but am sure it was very nice

Reviews.Title: “If you want a very clean and comfortable room and don't mind a dreadful location, this is the hotel to choose.”
Reviews.Author: Norwaycalling
Reviews.Content: I shared a double room with my teenage son. I've stayed in tiny, overpriced rooms in Bayswater, and so I appreciated the really spacious and comfortable modern room that we got here. The bathroom was spotless and, incredibly, everything worked well. Even the hairdryer was good! We got an excellent deal on Booking.com so no matter how dire the hotel might be, we weren't complaining. Even at the standard rates displayed in the lobby (GBP 99 per night for a double) it would have been ok. BUT: the hotel is really far away from Tower Bridge and you can't walk from the nearest tube (Elephant and Castle) because it's not a nice stroll through pretty streets, it's a long walk through absolutely miserable and honestly spooky areas. This is not a nice area of town. We had to take a taxi to the tube station every time, so if you stay here, only do it because you've got such an amazing deal that you can splash out on taxis all the time. We paid GBP 39 per night for our room, so we could get away with it, but deals like that are rare, and we were very lucky. The staff were reserved and quiet, but did help us with small things that we asked for; just don't expect huge smiles and "Receptionist of the Year" material. The room was either freezing or boiling, we never managed to suss out the air conditioning system so it was on and off all the time, and the windows were locked so no fresh air was available. Mind you, the street was so noisy that you can forget sleeping with the window open anyway - there were ambulances, police cars and fire trucks rocketing along the road every 10 mins or so all night long. Yep, bring ear plugs or get a room facing the back. We bought a good English breakfast at Elephant and Castle (by the tube) at Wetherspoon's for half the price of the hotel breakfast. I would never stay at the hotel alone as a female traveller, but travelling with others it was ok. (There's a Chinese/Sezchuan restaurant with access from the hotel lobby. The food was very good, very authentic, but NB: like a handful of other places in London, they slapped on a service charge of 10 %, not stated anywhere on the menu or otherwise, which annoyed us.) All in all, the hotel itself was excellent value by London standards (even if you're paying the standard rate) and it was surprisingly clean, modern and comfortable. It's just a real shame that it's placed in such a horrible spot and is so far from the tube. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel, but the buses take longer in London traffic and are harder for tourists to negotiate than the very user-friendly tube. I wouldn't stay there again and therefore wouldn't recommend it, but that's only because of the location. If you're a backpacker or don't mind being in a rough area, I do recommend it very highly as it's basically a good hotel in a terrible location.

Reviews.Title: “Take your own air conditionining and ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: tobyjuggs10
Reviews.Content: Great location for city and with parking so initially looked good. BUT the room was absolutely roasting and the windows were locked closed. The air conditioning wouldn't let you turn it on below 22 degrees. My room was located at the front of the hotel. The room had no sound proofing what so ever from the main busy road below. I know London roads are constantly busy you would have thought that good quality sound proofing was essential. My home double glazing has more sound proofing. The room was also very dirty and dusty. If you like your bedroom to feel like a sauna and you are deaf you should have no problems sleeping !!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Xaine05
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights in this hotel and felt it was quite alright. The nearest tube station is a good 20 mins walk away, but if you were smart enough to get a Travel Card or Oyster card you can certainly make use of the bus just outside the hotel that can drop you off at the Elephant and Castle station, the buses to take will be the 53, 453 or 172 which come every few minutes. The staff English could have been better and the price for using the wireless Internet is a complete rip off - about £3.00 per 30 mins. If you need to make a phone call be warned you cannot call out unless you go downstairs and pay for some call credit. Rooms were cleaned daily although this is a bare minimum clean and the sheets aren't replaced. The area is certainly the poorer part of town but we never felt scared or threatened. There is no laundry or laundry service so you'll need to use the Laundrette down the street, which is good value and fast machines with a very helpful attendant. Our room was very small with little room to move, although we saw another room next door when it was being cleaned and it had a lot more floor space. So if you're too cramped maybe ask for another room, they definitely have larger ones. The room has a safe so be sure to lock away your valuables when you leave, you never can be too sure.

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt our weekend”
Reviews.Author: RT2220
Reviews.Content: During my one night stay with my 12 year old daughter, I had approx £600 worth of property stolen from the room. I called the Police at half past midnight and they came out to the scene. They are still investigating. Apparnetly, a Hotel exmployee allowed strangers into the room and lett them there unattended whilst we were out at the theatre. The Hotel is not communicating with me and have, so far, refused to even refund my room tariff. I suggest this hotel is removed from the Vist London website. I would not want any other traveller - especially from overseas to have such a stressful experience as we have. It gives London a bad name!

Reviews.Title: “Grotty and basic”
Reviews.Author: josiepuds
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels in London on business and this has to be the worst. The local area is run down and have a very intimidating feel about it. When I arrived at the hotel the staff communication was limted to say the least, the first room they sent me to stank of cigarettes and smoke so I was moved to another room. This was ok but very basic and small, not even a bar of soap provided.. cofee cups but no spoon as a crusty Iron which just looked like a hazzard. The shower was good even though I had to brave the neighbourhood to buy some shower gel as the £100 per night provided none. Wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyably average stay.”
Reviews.Author: ughughCO
Reviews.Content: It is tough finding decently priced hotels in London during the summer, especially when booking less than a month before travelling. If you fall into this category, then you might want to CONSIDER the Premier Inn by Eurotraveller. Now that London has the visitor oyster card, getting to this hotel is not so bad. Its closest Tube Stop is Elephant & Castle (which has a lovely market with good Jamaican Jerk Chicken, Ethiopian Food, sometimes Traditional Hungarian Food, Smoothies, and cheap stuff ...). From there, good luck finding New Kent Road, but when you do, take one of the many buses that go to Old Kent Road (there are two bus stops close to each other, and you wait at the SECOND bus stop). It's about a 5 minute bus ride to the hotel. The area is not as cute as London, but it's not dangerous, and there is a nice mixture of people. The hotel, as I said before, is inexpensive. If two of you decide to sleep in a double room for one, then it's 89 pounds a night, and the room is really small. The air conditioning is extremely strong, however, which is GREAT for the hot summer days. Somehow they managed to squeeze an ironing board and an iron into the "cabin" (as it's labeled), and it works in 18-minute increments (don't know where they came up with that unit of time). The staff was quick to help us when we had problems - clog in the shower, needed an extra coffee/tea mug, air conditioner seemed broken (but our card was not deep enough into the slot), internet code not working, needed more soap, etc ... The only real issue was noise from a live-band night at the local Guatemalan restaurant, and the high-high price for internet. If you choose to get the 2pound hour internet, know that it is cumulative and not consecutive, meaning you can use 20 minutes, then use the rest later ... etc ... Also, it seems like this place SELLS a lot of things that should be free, and does not offer some things that a hotel should have; they did not have a sewing kit, and they sell ice ... TV was good, safe worked very well ... coffee was not good according to my husband, tea was okay with milk and sugar. It was an average, mediocre hotel. If you like walking (like me) and not paying for internet (like me), you can pick up a signal at either the Art Cafe (about a 25 minute walk away on London Road, shorter if you take the bus), or get free Wi-Fi at Del'Aziz or The Table (highly recommended). Try not to buy internet from a place like this - cheap rooms, so they have to overcharge on other things to compensate. Their free map of London is not bad, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and price for London”
Reviews.Author: pinkladytiff83
Reviews.Content: A friend and I (both in our late twenties) decided to have a weekend in London and were looking for a cheap (but half decent!) hotel, and this was perfect! Check in was smooth, rooms were fantastically clean and very modern and spacious, there was a bus stop only a minute away which takes you into central london (takes about 20mins or so). The location was the only slight downside as it a bit confusing to get to, the nearest tube is elephant and castle (not tower bridge as you might expect), but reception staff are very helpful with giving directions etc. Old Kent Road is not the best street in London (its the cheapest plot on the monopoly board after all!), but apart from that, lovely modern hotel and had a great nights stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Kazermc
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel at 9.00 pm. I had travelled from Euston the area is not the best and do not recommend a woman to go alone. The hotel rooms could do with a clean the showers are dirty. I DO recommend travellers that book online CHECK when they get their credit card signature photocopied that the correct side is copied as I had to have a heated discussion as the gentleman had copied the frontof my card eventually I got this back. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AND WOULD NEVER STAY IN IT AGAIN. Very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: goldenhalcyondays
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for over a week and were very happy with the hotel. The rooms were quite large compared to others in the same price range we experienced round europe. They were modern and the bathrooms were extremely clean. The only negative was the location. It was a bit far out (25 minute bus ride to trafalgar square) however there were constant buses going to the city centre (approx. every 7 minutes). It is in a bit of a lower economic area however it was quite safe to walk the 50 meters from the bus stop alone at night (for a female) as there are businesses open at all hours. It was far easier to use the bus then the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back!”
Reviews.Author: jwturpin
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were a little generous about how close to Elephant and Castle the hotel was when I spoke to them on the phone. From the tube, it's a 10 min bus journey on the 453, or £6 in a taxi, or a good half hour walk. Hotel was clean, airy, very modern and most importantly, this extended to the room, and was not just a reception facade. 4 adults in a 4 bed 'cabin' room with two singles and a double. PLENTY of room to move around, not falling over each other! Facilities excellent! 32" plasma with Freeview on the wall, Iron and fold away ironing board, hairdryer, mini fridge, international sockets. If I HAD to make negative comments : Shower curtain too short, water goes on floor! No extra plug socket next to mirror for straighteners or your own hair dryer. Bedside lights are low energy LED reading lamps - crap. OVERALL - great experience, would definitely go back without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent low budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonReg
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2 double rooms [i.e. 4 travellers] for one night in Sept. 2009, admittedley the area is by no means the best part of London but we felt safe and secure and we were only 15 mins. walk or a short bus ride to the nearest tube station [Elephant & Castle / Tower Hill]. The Hotel itself has recently been refurbished and is very hip and trendy, the rooms were of good size and fitted out to a much higher standard than the price charged. Each room had a 6 jet power shower, unfortunately one jet was directed right up the Jacksey. The staff were helpful and friendly and all in all better than many more expensive hotels we have stayed at in London. One tip ask for a room not facing the main road outside as I would guess they could suffer from road noise.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you are on business or a woman travelling alone!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladytraveller13
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel at 9.45 pm. I had travelled into St Pancras and then got a tube to the Elephant and Castle underground which is a very run down area and as a woman alone I did not feel safe. I had to walk approx 5 minutes to find a cab office, which was down a dark dungy side street. I got a cab to the hotel which was also in a very run down area. The hotel itself was average, and the room was clean. I stayed 2 nights at the hotel and for the whole 2 days the WiFi was not working, I was offered to use a PC in the main lobby, but I did not feel safe alone and could not retrieve my emails anyway. I could not work in the evenings which was a huge inconvenience!!! I would not recommend this hotel to a woman travelling alone or anyone staying for business who needs WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahj33
Reviews.Content: We booked this over the internet, the internet rates are great, car parking is fantastic its just behind the hotel and its barrier entrance so very secure and you have your own allocated bay and its 24 hour CCTV. Our visit was to the Oval cricket ground and this was perfect, very reasonable rates, we got 2 bus stops and 2 northern line stops although we walked back from the tube its all one road and it was about 20mins walk. The reception staff were very friendly and the lobbey was very nice, our room was very nice, compact but had space for what we needed you had a safe, fridge, tea & coffee making wall mounted tv, iron board, all in all very good value and extremely clean and comfy bed and airy room. I would recommend this hotel especially if you want value for money, breakfast was £10 but we did not have this so cannot comment, Great stay

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: Northeasttrips
Reviews.Content: Are you looking for somewhere just to get your head down? Go here. The continental breakfast is bizzare but it's plentiful and there is the choice of full english if you want it. Next door is a really good quality chinese restaurant for evening food. The area isn't great no wonder it's the cheap street on the monopoly board!!!! Elephant and Castle isn't exactly the best area either. Lots of boarded up houses/flats and it's a run down area. However! You can get a zillion buses outside the door that go direct into central London in less than 15 minutes. Very close to Westminster and Trafalgar Square on the bus. Tube station at Elephant and Castle is a bus ride or 15 minute walk away. Greenwich a bus ride away. Would recommend it but if it's for a decent holiday or romantic break book somewehre else

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Obafemi123
Reviews.Content: I like the services of the staff ,I read review by someone she said staff are rude but staff are very friendly.I was thr when this lady came to cpomplain.She didn't stay at the hotel she is living opp to the hotel.It doesn't make any different for the hotel if you put the your reviews outside the hotel.Church people start at 12 o'clock not in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in London...”
Reviews.Author: Princess1980London
Reviews.Content: Woken up by music blaring from car outside, unloading music equipment into hotel. When I complained, rude receptionist told me it wasn't his problem and the noise was from a so called 'church group' using a room in the hotel. The service is awful, staff are rude and noise from the room (at front) was so bad I couldn't sleep. Avoid like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: loulou2878
Reviews.Content: Just returned from London visiting family in hospital there, stayed at the Premier on Old Kent Rd which has been built quite recently , would definetely recommend it. Great price, very clean, well looked after rooms with nice decor and super comfy bed and pillows. We stayed three nights Sat-Tues had booked two rooms. Local ameneties i.e food not so great however bus stops right near hotel entrance and it's a 24hr bus service, not too expensive in a taxi either to centre of London-we were £14. People in local grocers very nice and helpful and sell the all day bus tickets which are great. Area not much to look at but I felt safe enough. My shower wasnt working so I had to move rooms after first night-staff were very helpful. Large TV on wall which had built in freeview-great. Kettle supplied in room for tea/coffee. Small fridge supplied in room. Only downside no wardrobe! Only a small clothes rail with few hangers on it. DO NOT use the Chinese adjoined to the building, worst meal i've ever had!! However my parents liked the food in Ozzies cafe just a few doors down. I recommend you eat before returning to hotel as local amenities are a bit scarce. There is a Tesco just along the road from hotel. Also people had chinese takeaway meals delivered to hotel from elsewhere which hotel staff were ok with and supplied plates, cutlery etc. If your looking for an above average hotel (I loved it and can be fussy) then this is it but I definetely recommend it and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolMother
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay, we stayed in a family room, with a 1yr old. It was clean, a good size and the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel on main bus route”
Reviews.Author: WallyLondon
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel. Comfortable beds. Rooms are small but very typical of rooms in Europe. The building has been converted into a hotel December of 2007. It is on the bus route and close to restaurants and a grocery store. We used the small fridge for breakfast & lunch supplies. The room we had was at the back so we didn't here any traffic noise. There are small markets nearby and fresh cooked chickens which were tasty for dinner. It takes two buses or the tube and a bus to get there from Victoria station. We enjoyed it there and only spent the nights inh the room anyways. Good hotel for the price and the city of London.

Reviews.Title: “Weird hotel experience - won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: flyby21
Reviews.Content: Run by Indian owners - the hotel has that feel of being abroad in a low quality hotel yet it's newly decorated. The style would match that of temperatures outside of 80degrees but in cold London - tiles on the floor, lino as flooring in the room, air conditioning which doesn't heat the room well doens't match the requirements for this country. Taps in the bathrrom only pore water if you bend over and are close enough will automatically come on and you get soaked. The shower is small and an issue for anyone trying to have a wash! No bar - well it's part of reception and not inviting. The dining area is not comfortable and cold and bland in the morning. The walk from Elephant and Castle is long around 20 mintues and with a bag not good. Also, the hotel is not in a nice area. The hotel doesn't have an evening restaurant and will invite pizza and chinese companies to deliver take aways. There are no local restaurants I would feel comfortable in - carribean run restaurants, I saw gangs on the streets and went swiftly back to the hotel. Traffic is a huge issue in the morning and delays if you have meetings. The bed was comfortable and have flat screens but feel they have cut corners all over the place to save money and has had a detrimental feeling to comfort and a relaxing ambience. Asked to leave as soon as I checked in but I had paid and no refunds. Stayed for 3 nights. Will NEVER stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Premier by Eurotraveller
HotelInfo.Address: 194-202 Old Kent Road, London SE1 5TY, England
